title: Deploy and Adjust Sea Anchor to Control Raft Movement
brief: Use sea anchor to stay near crash site for rescue or control raft direction and speed with current.
steps: Step 1: Throw out sea anchor immediately to stay close to ditching site for easier rescue.
Step 2: Position sea anchor so when raft is on wave crest, anchor is in wave trough.
Step 3: Open sea anchor apex to create drag and keep raft in general area.
Step 4: Close sea anchor apex to form pocket for current to strike and propel raft with current.
Step 5: Wrap sea anchor rope with cloth to prevent chafing the raft.
Step 6: Adjust anchor to keep raft headed into wind and waves.
warnings: Without sea anchor, raft may drift over 160 kilometers in a day, making rescue much harder.
Always wrap rope with cloth to prevent damage to raft from chafing.
In stormy water, keep sea anchor away from bow to prevent capsizing.
source: FM21-76_SurvivalManual.pdf — U.S. Department of the Army
